author: dariok
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> $uri1 = New-Object System.Uri -ArgumentList ("https://localhost/ingest/jg1798/07%2F1798-07-25.xml")
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> $uri2 = New-Object System.Uri -ArgumentList ("https://localhost/ingest/jg1798/07%2F1798-07-25.xml", "true")
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> $uri3 = "https://localhost/ingest/jg1798/07%2F1798-07-25.xml"

PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> Invoke-WebRequest $uri1 -Method Post -WebSession $diasession -ContentType application/xml -InFile $file
Invoke-WebRequest :                      
404 Not Found
Not Found
The requested URL /exist/restxq/edoc/admin/ingest/jg1798/07/1798-07-25.xml was not found on this server.

PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> $uri.UserEscaped
True
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> Invoke-WebRequest $uri2 -Method Post -WebSession $diasession -ContentType application/xml -InFile $file
Invoke-WebRequest :                      
404 Not Found
Not Found
The requested URL /exist/restxq/edoc/admin/ingest/jg1798/07/1798-07-25.xml was not found on this server.

PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> Invoke-WebRequest $uri3 -Method Post -WebSession $diasession -ContentType application/xml -InFile $file
Invoke-WebRequest :                      
404 Not Found
Not Found
The requested URL /exist/restxq/edoc/admin/ingest/jg1798/07/1798-07-25.xml was not found on this server.

```

# Expected behavior
The URL used should be `https://localhost/ingest/jg1798/07%2F1798-07-25.xml`
A URL-encoded string should not be decoded before send. This is especially true if, as in `$uri2` above, `$uri2.UserEscaped` is set to `true` (or is this a complete misnoma?).

# Actual behavior
The URL used is `https://localhost/ingest/jg1798/07/1798-07-25.xml`, all URL-encoding is decoded and a wrong URL is used, rendering PowerShell unsuable for this request.

# Environment data
```powershell
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.3
OS                             Linux 4.15.0-65-generic #74-Ubuntu SMP Tue Sep 17 17:06:04 UTC 2019
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

*Edit:*
# Status of possible workarounds
I consulted StackOverflow (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43129163/powershell-invoke-webrequest-to-a-url-with-literal-2f-in-it and similar). The suggestions there do not work:

```powershell
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing>   $UnEscapeDotsAndSlashes = 0x2000000;
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing>   $SimpleUserSyntax = 0x20000;
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> 
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing>   $type = $uri.GetType();
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing>   $fieldInfo = $type.GetField("m_Syntax", ([System.Reflection.BindingFlags]::Instance -bor [System.Reflection.BindingFlags]::NonPublic));
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing> 
PS /home/dario/diarium-processing>   $uriParser = $fieldInfo.GetValue($uri);
You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
At line:1 char:3
+   $uriParser = $fieldInfo.GetValue($uri);
+   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull

```

comments.body:
@dariok Thanks for your report! 

It seems it is .Net Core issue. For your example:
```powershell
 $uri2

AbsolutePath   : /ingest/jg1798/07%2F1798-07-25.xml
AbsoluteUri    : https://localhost/ingest/jg1798/07%2F1798-07-25.xml
LocalPath      : /ingest/jg1798/07/1798-07-25.xml
Authority      : localhost
```
Here LocalPath is already broken.
I suggest you open new issue in CoreFX repository. Better with C# repo example.

comments.body: From .Net team comment it is the server error, not client or .Net.
